title: MaskPrune: Mask-based LLM Pruning for Layer-wise Uniform Structures
author: Jiayu Qin (Nanjing University), Jianchao Tan (Meituan), Kefeng Zhang (Meituan), Xunliang Cai (Meituan), Wei Wang (Nanjing University), ...
relevance_why: The proposed method's optimization-based structure pruning approach is relevant to improving text-to-audio generation frameworks, potentially enhancing model efficiency and performance.
background: The paper addresses the challenge of efficiently pruning large language models (LLMs) while maintaining a uniform layer structure to enhance deployment and inference performance.
contribution: MaskPrune introduces a novel masking learning paradigm through minimax optimization to achieve uniform structured pruning of LLMs while maintaining high model performance.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Existing pruning methods often lead to heterogeneity across layers, complicating model deployment and further training.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work optimizes both the pruning masks and target dimensions concurrently, ensuring uniformity across layers throughout the training process.

key_innovation: Proposes the use of minimax optimization to jointly learn pruning masks, which unlike traditional methods, preserves structural consistency across layers.
real_world_impact: The method can significantly improve the efficiency of deploying large language models in resource-constrained environments, enhancing practical applications in various domains including audio and speech processing.
limitations: The effectiveness of mask learning-based pruning may depend heavily on the quality and appropriateness of training data.

new_terms.minimax optimization: **Minimax optimization** is a strategy commonly used in game theory that seeks to minimize the maximum loss, often applied in scenarios where the decision-maker confronts adversarial conditions.
